articles.summary: Motley Fool: Billionaires Buy 2 Trillion-Dollar AI Stocks Hand Over Fist Ahead of 2026. These top hedge fund managers own large stakes in Google-parent Alphabet and Meta Platforms. Related tickers mentioned: GOOG, META.

articles.title: Why BMO Sees Alphabet (GOOGL) Benefiting From Expanding AI Cloud Commitments
articles.mainIdea: Why BMO Sees Alphabet (GOOGL) Benefiting From Expanding AI Cloud Commitments
articles.summary: Insider Monkey: Why BMO Sees Alphabet (GOOGL) Benefiting From Expanding AI Cloud Commitments. Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) is one of the AI Stocks Making Waves on Wall Street. On December 16, BMO Capital raised its price target on the stock to $343.00 from $340.00 while maintaining an “Outperform” rating. The firm remains confident in Google Cloud’s acceleration and long-term AI monetization following cloud-focused expert calls with former AWS employees. […] Related tickers mentioned: GOOG.

articles.title: CHAT vs. XLK: Leaning Into AI’s Next Phase or Anchoring in Mega-Cap Tech
articles.mainIdea: CHAT vs. XLK: Leaning Into AI’s Next Phase or Anchoring in Mega-Cap Tech
articles.summary: Motley Fool: CHAT vs. XLK: Leaning Into AI’s Next Phase or Anchoring in Mega-Cap Tech. Both ETFs invest in technology, but they reflect very different views of where value will come from. One anchors exposure to today’s market leaders, while the other leans into how generative AI could reshape returns over time Related tickers mentioned: XLK, ^GSPC.
